channel.title: Inversion | 317 CLIENT WITH HIGH DEFINITION!
channel.description:
[CENTER][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/RVeV3dJ.png[/img]
[SIZE=4]Introduction[/SIZE]
Hello and welcome to Inversion's project thread! Here is a little run down on some of my goals and the server itself. What I'd really like to achieve is making this server to the community's liking; I want the community to have the best and smoothest gameplay. Not only do I have the time to do this, I also have funds supporting this project; at the start I don't really worry about an income from the server, I try to make the server a lot more unique before asking for donations. The base I am going to use is a blank Project Insanity server and client, what I am currently working on before any other updates is player stability - this is the key thing to a smooth game play. We are going to make this server a 317 loading 634.[/CENTER]
[hr]
[SIZE=4]Developers & Contributors[/SIZE]
Server Sided:
[ul][li]Restriction[/li] [li]Ivo from R-S[/li] [li]Tutorial[/li][/ul]
Client Sided:
[ul][li]Earl Sweatshirt from R-S[/li][/ul]
Web Developer:
[ul][li]The Web Guy (Aj)[/li][/ul]
C++ Developer:
[ul][li]Cold Fusion - Doesn't have a Moparscape account.[/li][/ul]
Graphics Designer:
[ul][li]Contact me for this position.[/li] [li]Contact me for this position.[/li][/ul]
Community Manager:
[ul][li]Shane[/li][/ul]
[hr]
[B][SIZE=5]Features[/SIZE][/B]
Green - Done Orange - In progress Red - Not started
[IMG]http://runehints.com/images/skills-icon.png[/img] [SIZE=4]Skills[/SIZE]
[SIZE=3]Woodcutting[/SIZE]
[ul][li]Timers[/li] [li]Stumps[/li] [li]Nests[/li] [li]Animations[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Firemaking[/SIZE]
[ul][li]Ashes[/li] [li]Timers[/li] [li]Animations[/li] [li]Clipping[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Fletching[/SIZE]
[ul][li]Timers[/li] [li]Bow Strings[/li] [li]Animations[/li] [li]Make 1, 5, 10, All[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Herblore[/SIZE]
[ul][li]Multiple Ingredients[/li] [li]Timers[/li] [li]Make 1, 5, 10, All[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Cooking[/SIZE]
[ul][li]Clipped ItemOnObject[/li] [li]All Fish[/li] [li]Proper Formulas[/li] [li]Make 1, 5, 10, All[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Mining[/SIZE]
[ul][li]All Rocks Minable[/li] [li]Empty Rock Replacement[/li] [li]All Pickaxe's Usable[/li] [li]Accurate Mining Formula[/li] [li]Gems[/li] [li]Rune/Pure Essence[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Smithing[/SIZE]
[ul][li]All Bars Smeltable[/li] [li]All Equipment Creatable[/li] [li]Gold Bar Smithing[/li] [li]Correct Experience[/li] [li]Make 1, 5, 10, All[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Fishing[/SIZE]
[ul][li]All Fish Fishable[/li] [li]Correct Experience[/li] [li]Proper Bait Usage[/li] [li]First & Second Click Fishing[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Cooking[/SIZE]
[ul][li]All Interfaces & Amounts Working[/li] [li]All Fish Cookable[/li] [li]Accurate Burn Formula[/li] [li]Cooking Gauntlets helping cooking[/li] [li]No burn levels[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Prayer[/SIZE]
[ul][li]All Bones Buryable[/li] [li]Correct Experience[/li] [li]Bones On Altar[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Thieving[/SIZE]
[ul][li]Correct Pickpocketing Data[/li] [li]Accurate Pickpocketing Formula[/li] [li]Correct Experience[/li] [li]Npc Forced Chat & Damage mask[/li] [li]Thieving From Stalls[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Runecrafting[/SIZE]
[ul][li]All Runes Craftable[/li] [li]All Pouches Useable[/li] [li]Full Abyss[/li] [li]Correct Multiplier & Experience[/li][/ul]
[SIZE=3]Thieving[/SIZE]
[ul][li]Jewelry Making[/li] [li]Gem Cutting[/li] [li]Hide Tanning[/li] [li]Armor Crafting[/li] [li]Pottery Crafting[/li] [li]Silver Moulding[/li][/ul]
[I]I will add the rest once these are done.[/I]
[hr]

item.dc:creator: @ixia ixia
item.description:
@ixia wrote:

[quote=“artem543, post:40, topic:536040”]This login screen is over used… The logo doesn’t match the aspect of the game. the animated background is just turning around?

Man, you shouldn’t hurry. It’s better to take time and accomplish stuff with quality work.[/quote]
That login screen is what RuneScape’s use to look like. The image is a .GIF and is just looping, this is why it looks like the camera is just moving in a circle (I assume there is more to the animated background).

Read full topic

item.title: Inversion | 317 CLIENT WITH HIGH DEFINITION!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“ixia, post:28, topic:536040”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=654843.msg4385992#msg4385992 date=1385573969]
When it comes to scripting content for an RSPS I can’t say I’ve used either extensively but I don’t imagine the differences being extreme.
[/quote]
There is quiet a big difference, try looking it up.[/quote]
It’s been looked into a hundred and fifty thousand times and the same conclusion comes out: it’s going to be an ongoing debate. Ruby has advantages over Python, likewise vice versa. When it comes to something like an RSPS most of the programmers are well below par and therefore I’d suggest they went with what they felt comfortable with. If they feel comfortable writing in python and think they can write efficient code then bash on, if they prefer to write in Ruby then go ahead. The speed difference when Ruby was in it’s 1.8 stage then might have been worth it if they felt comfortable but not overly confident but right now the speed between the languages are very, very similar and this is now when you start getting into the nitty gritty stuff like Ruby has blocks but Python has generators etc. It’s just an ongoing debate that will probably never be solved until one language has a major breakthrough.

Read full topic

item.title: Inversion | 317 CLIENT WITH HIGH DEFINITION!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“ixia, post:25, topic:536040”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=654843.msg4385946#msg4385946 date=1385548128]

Oh I see Ruby thank you for that small background… Do you think python would be fine with a rsps?

Yeah python works well with scripting content for RSPS, not to mention it’s ridiculously easy to pick up and become somewhat useful with it in no time. If you’re going to be using it within RSPS take a look at Jython, that’ll be a good starting point.
[/quote]
plz Ruby use Ruby[/quote]
When it comes to scripting content for an RSPS I can’t say I’ve used either extensively but I don’t imagine the differences being extreme.

Read full topic
